intro: Tritoma × praecox, commonly known as the early tritoma, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Tritoma × praecox is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological habitats.
